CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 19, 1960, pg. A12, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. Louie C. Bates Jr. - Harris photo." Accompanying article reads: "Thompson - Bates Nuptials Read by Reverend Harvey -  Arlene R. Thompson made a charming bride when she was united in marriage to Louie C. Bates, Jr., recently, in pretty rites performed by Rev. William J. Harvey III, in the home of the bride. The new Mrs. Bates is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Thompson and the groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Louie Bates, Sr. The bride wore a stunning ballerina length white nylon lace dress and a shoulder corsage. An eye-length veil trimmed the tiny white hat. Miss Carole Thompson, sister of the bride, was maid of honor, and wore a powder blue ballerina length dress. The groom's father was best man. The brid [bride] is a secretary at The Pittsburgh Courier, and the groom is a student at the Art Institute."
TitMainTitle: Groom Louie C. Bates Jr. and bride Arlene R. Thompson Bates, posed behine three-tiered wedding cake in Thompson home
